page.title: 20ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: Tiff Hetherington is one of the few thatchers left in Devon. He learned his trade as an apprentice. To thatch a house he starts at the right and works across in courses. The courses are vertical strips made up of horizontal strips called lones.He uses wheat and water reeds. Sculpting is a very skilled trade.First you make a drawing and gradually build on your idea.This takes time and is the hardest part. Then you make a metal skeleton of your figure for support. Next you pack on the clay.When you have made your figure you cast it by putting plaster onto the figure in two halves so that you can take it off easily.Then you fill that with plaster and get a hard figure.You can use rubber but it's expensive.Bronze or resin is used for the final figure by Nicholas Dimbleby.
